str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To resist, oppose, withstand, lie opposite to. From anti and keimai; to lie opposite, i.e. Be adverse to.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Lit: To raise beyond, uplift; mid: To lift myself up, exalt myself, be arrogant.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
An object of worship or veneration. From sebazomai; something adored, i.e. An object of worship.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A temple, a shrine, that part of the temple where God himself resides. From a primary naio; a fane, shrine, temple.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and deiknuo; to show off, i.e. Exhibit; figuratively, to demonstrate, i.e. Accredit.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
